info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 11:32PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CHENANGO...CORTLAND... SOUTHERN CAYUGA...TIOGA...BROOME...DELAWARE...AND TOMPKINS COUNTIES... HAZARDS... Several bands of moderate to heavy snow showers accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. A quick half inch or so of snow can fall in about 15 minutes. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1130 PM EST, an area of heavy snow was along a line extending from near South Cortland to near Sanford and moving southeast at 15 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Binghamton, Cortland, Johnson City, Maine, Danby, Homer, Caroline, Sanford, Virgil and Groton. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 near 3, and between 5 and 12. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 75 and 84. Interstate 88 between 1 and 7. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this area of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
